channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report E-2024010179
item.description:
Report E-2024010179

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: approximately 4 gallons of Sure Klean 600 were released from two 2-gallon plastic jugs due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024010154
item.description:
Report X-2024010154

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT RECIEVED A CALL ABOUT A CORROSIVE PACKAGE WITH A STRONG ODOR AT DOOR 152 IN THE OUTBOUNDS. HAZMAT RESPONDER RESPONDED FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE/ RESPONSE SHEET TO PROPERLY HANDLE PACKAGE BEFORE BRINGING ITEMS TO HAZMAT CAGE AND THEN FOLLOWED WASTE DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024010153
item.description:
Report X-2024010153

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND PACKAGE ON THE CATWALK WITH 2 SIDE WET. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.

item.title: Report E-2024010141
item.description:
Report E-2024010141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: SALISBURY
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The trailer was fine until it arrived to offload. Once they started offloading the trailer began dripping 2 drips every 5 seconds. They were able to contain the leak to a bucket and finished the offload so it could be sent for repairs. We're a bit surprised it started leaking at the time it did. Usually when doing a pump offload it creates a 'vacuum' away from the source of the leak and slows it down. In this case this is when it started leaking. I likely has to do with when the internal valve was opened though that allowed it to get to the sump gasket. That is what actually leaked.
